_source.description: 1/13/2013: Today is Curried chicken Day,  a popular dish in Asia, the United Kingdom, and the Caribbean. The word “curry” is an anglicized version of the Tamil word “kari,” which means “stir-fried.” While we usually associate curried chicken with a hot Indian dish served over rice, there are many other recipes that call for both key ingredients. In England, curried chicken salad is called Coronation Chicken created for Queen Elizabeth coronation banquet in 1953.
_source.title: Food Of The Day

_source.description: “Is the big football game a must see in your house? This year I will be making cherry chipotle chicken wings…. Oh my word. _source.description: Easy chicken dinner baked in the oven for an hour… Roasted Lemon Chicken w/ Potatoes & Rosemary: 8-10 pieces of your favorite cut of chicken – skin on; 1 lb. baby red potatoes; ½ onion – cut in large pieces; 2 lemons, 1 sliced and 1 juiced;  ⅓ cup olive oil; 2 garlic cloves, minced; 1 Tablespoon fresh Rosemary plus sprigs for garnish; ½ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes; 1½ teaspoon salt; ½ teaspoon fresh ground pepper. Bake @ 400F.
_source.title: Roasted Lemon Chicken with Potatoes and Rosemary

_source.description: Put one pound of washed raw cranberries through the food processor. Add 1/2 cup of sugar, 1/3 cup of horseradish, and one teaspoon of lemon juice. Put in a jar and cover or put it into a dish and cover it. Leave in refrigerator for a couple of days to mellow the flavor. Great with turkey or chicken.  Read more: Recipe: Cranberry and Horseradish Relish http://www.globalgourmet.com/food/egg/egg1296/cranrlsh.html#ixzz2kmzZUsYR
